note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY – MECHANICAL DEBULKING OF TRACHEAL GRANULATION

Patient: Michael Brown, 70-year-old male
MRN: S31640-011
Date: 2024-06-30
Location: Riverside Community Hospital – Bronchoscopy Suite
Attending: Dr. Nina Patel

Indication:
Chronic cough and wheeze from tracheal granulation tissue around an old tracheostomy site, now decannulated.

Procedure:
Flexible bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of tracheal granulation tissue (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia / Sedation:
Moderate sedation (midazolam, fentanyl) and topical lidocaine. Native airway. ASA class II.

Findings:
Irregular granulation tissue circumferentially at the mid-trachea where prior tracheostomy had been, narrowing the lumen to about 60%.

Interventions:
Multiple passes of forceps debulking were performed to remove the granulation tissue in piecemeal fashion. Snare resection was used for a pedunculated portion. The procedure consisted solely of mechanical excision and debulking; no ablation or thermal therapy was delivered.

Hemostasis:
Minor oozing controlled with cold saline.

EBL:
5–10 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Observed in recovery and discharged home with inhaled corticosteroid and PPI therapy. Planned surveillance bronchoscopy in 3 months.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Symptomatic tracheal stenosis from post-tracheostomy granulation tissue.
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT neck with focal mid-tracheal narrowing at prior tracheostomy site.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Flexible bronchoscopy with forceps and snare resection of tracheal granulation tissue.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Benign post-tracheostomy granulation tissue causing tracheal stenosis.

lines.selection_reason: Documentation supports mechanical debulking/excision (forceps, snare) without thermal ablation.

per_code.summary: Kept. Supported by explicit description of mechanical excision (forceps, snare) and absence of thermal ablation.

global_comments: Procedure involved purely mechanical debulking; CPT 31640 is appropriate.

note_text:
BRONCHOSCOPY OPERATIVE REPORT – MECHANICAL DEBULKING

Patient: Hannah Lee, 47-year-old female
MRN: S31640-012
Date: 2024-07-14
Facility: Mountain View Medical Center – OR
Attending: Dr. Victor Chang

Indication:
Malignant obstruction of the bronchus intermedius from small cell lung cancer with collapse of right lower lobe.

Procedure:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of bronchus intermedius tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia:
General anesthesia with rigid bronchoscope. ASA class III.

Findings:
Bulky endobronchial tumor in the bronchus intermedius with 90% obstruction; distal RLL bronchus occluded with mucus.

Interventions:
Rigid coring performed with the rigid bronchoscope to mechanically debulk the tumor. Forceps debulking removed remaining tumor fragments. The lumen was mechanically reopened to approximately 50–60% patency. No balloon dilation or thermal ablation was used.

Hemostasis:
Controlled with cold saline irrigation and topical epinephrine.

EBL:
40 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Remained intubated for postoperative ventilatory support in ICU.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Bronchus intermedius obstruction due to small cell lung cancer.
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: Right hilar mass with bronchus intermedius occlusion and RLL collapse.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking for malignant central airway obstruction.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Small cell lung carcinoma with central airway involvement.

lines.selection_reason: Documentation supports mechanical debulking/excision (rigid coring, forceps) without thermal ablation.

per_code.summary: Kept. Supported by explicit description of mechanical excision (rigid coring, forceps) and absence of thermal ablation.

global_comments: Procedure involved purely mechanical debulking; CPT 31640 is appropriate.

note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY – RIGID BRONCHOSCOPY WITH MECHANICAL DEBULKING

Patient: Christopher Adams, 62-year-old male
MRN: S31640-013
Date: 2024-07-29
Site: Harborview Cancer Institute – OR
Attending: Dr. Elena Rossi

Indication:
Mixed obstructive lesion at the distal trachea and carina from squamous cell lung cancer.

Procedure:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of distal tracheal and carinal tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia:
General anesthesia; rigid bronchoscope; ASA class III.

Findings:
Tumor occupying the distal trachea and encroaching on the carina, reducing lumen by ~75% and preferentially obstructing the right mainstem.

Interventions:
Mechanical debulking performed using rigid coring with the bronchoscope and forceps debulking of tumor at the distal trachea and carina. Snare resection was used for a polypoid component. No ablation (RFA, PDT, or cryotherapy) was used. Final airway patency improved with visible mainstem orifices and free airflow.

Hemostasis:
Mild bleeding controlled with cold saline.

EBL:
25 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Extubated, monitored in PACU, then admitted to oncology floor overnight.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Distal tracheal and carinal mass causing mixed central airway obstruction.
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT chest with distal tracheal mass and carinal involvement obstructing both main bronchi.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of distal tracheal and carinal tumor.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Endobronchial squamous cell carcinoma involving distal trachea and carina.

lines.selection_reason: Documentation supports mechanical debulking/excision (rigid coring, forceps, snare) without thermal ablation.

per_code.summary: Kept. Supported by explicit description of mechanical excision (rigid coring, forceps, snare) and absence of thermal ablation.

global_comments: Procedure involved purely mechanical debulking; CPT 31640 is appropriate.

note_text:
BRONCHOSCOPY NOTE – MECHANICAL DEBULKING OF RUL BRONCHUS TUMOR

Patient: Aisha Khan, 59-year-old female
MRN: S31640-014
Date: 2024-08-09
Location: Cityside Medical Center – Bronchoscopy Suite
Attending: Dr. Jason Miller

Indication:
Persistent collapse of right upper lobe due to endobronchial tumor at RUL bronchus.

Procedure:
Flexible bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of RUL tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia / Sedation:
Moderate sedation (propofol, fentanyl) via LMA. ASA class III.

Findings:
Polypoid tumor at the origin of the RUL bronchus causing 80% obstruction. No other central lesions.

Interventions:
Mechanical debulking performed using forceps and snare resection of the tumor. Tumor removed in piecemeal fashion until the RUL bronchus was widely patent. No thermal techniques (APC, laser, cryotherapy, PDT, or RFA) were used.

Hemostasis:
Minimal; controlled with cold saline.

EBL:
10 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Observed post-procedure and discharged home; CT chest ordered in 6 weeks to evaluate re-expansion.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Right upper lobe collapse from endobronchial tumor at RUL bronchus.
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: Right upper lobe collapse with central obstructing lesion on CT.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Flexible bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of RUL endobronchial tumor.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Endobronchial tumor of the RUL bronchus (histology pending).

lines.selection_reason: Documentation supports mechanical debulking/excision (forceps, snare) without thermal ablation.

per_code.summary: Kept. Supported by explicit description of mechanical excision (forceps, snare) and absence of thermal ablation.

global_comments: Procedure involved purely mechanical debulking; CPT 31640 is appropriate.

note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY PROCEDURE NOTE

Patient: Robert Wilson, 73-year-old male
MRN: S31640-015
Date: 2024-08-26
Location: Evergreen Thoracic Center – OR
Attending: Dr. Karen Li

Indication:
Severe dyspnea and wheezing from carinal and right mainstem tumor due to non–small cell lung cancer.

Procedure:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of carinal/right mainstem tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia:
General anesthesia; rigid bronchoscope. ASA class III.

Findings:
Tumor occupying the right side of the carina and proximal right mainstem with 80–85% obstruction, clot and mucus distally.

Interventions:
Mechanical debulking with rigid coring and forceps was performed at the carina and right mainstem. Microdebrider used to smooth the tumor base. Debulking was entirely mechanical without thermal ablation. Lumen patency improved to ~50%.

Hemostasis:
Moderate oozing controlled with cold saline and topical epinephrine.

EBL:
45 mL.

Complications:
Transient desaturation to 90%, resolved with recruitment.

Disposition:
Admitted to ICU intubated for close monitoring given high tumor burden.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Carinal and right mainstem obstruction from non–small cell lung carcinoma.
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: Central mass at carina with right lung volume loss.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of carinal/right mainstem tumor.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Centrally obstructing non–small cell lung carcinoma involving the carina and right mainstem.

lines.selection_reason: Documentation supports mechanical debulking/excision (rigid coring, forceps, microdebrider) without thermal ablation.

per_code.summary: Kept. Supported by explicit description of mechanical excision (rigid coring, forceps, microdebrider) and absence of thermal ablation.

global_comments: Procedure involved purely mechanical debulking; CPT 31640 is appropriate.

note_text:
BRONCHOSCOPY PROCEDURE NOTE – MECHANICAL DEBULKING OF LLL BRONCHUS MASS

Patient: Emily Garcia, 52-year-old female
MRN: S31640-016
Date: 2024-09-03
Facility: Westside Pulmonary Institute – Bronchoscopy Suite
Attending: Dr. Sean O’Neill

Indication:
Recurrent post-obstructive pneumonia of the left lower lobe due to endobronchial mass at LLL bronchus.

Procedure:
Flexible bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of LLL endobronchial tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia / Sedation:
Moderate sedation with propofol; LMA. ASA class II.

Findings:
Exophytic lesion at the origin of the LLL bronchus with 75% obstruction and purulent secretions distally.

Interventions:
After suctioning secretions and lavage, forceps debulking and snare resection were used to mechanically debulk and excise the tumor. No cryotherapy, PDT, RFA, or APC were used.

Hemostasis:
Minimal; controlled with cold saline.

EBL:
10 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Discharged home from recovery with oral antibiotics and follow-up bronchoscopy in 3 months.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Recurrent post-obstructive pneumonia from LLL endobronchial mass.
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: Left lower lobe consolidation with central obstructing lesion.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Flexible bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of LLL tumor.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Endobronchial tumor of the left lower lobe bronchus (histology pending).

lines.selection_reason: Documentation supports mechanical debulking/excision (forceps, snare) without thermal ablation.

per_code.summary: Kept. Supported by explicit description of mechanical excision (forceps, snare) and absence of thermal ablation.

global_comments: Procedure involved purely mechanical debulking; CPT 31640 is appropriate.

note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY – RIGID BRONCHOSCOPY WITH MECHANICAL DEBULKING

Patient: Steven Park, 60-year-old male
MRN: S31640-017
Date: 2024-09-20
Hospital: Granite Peak Medical Center – OR
Attending: Dr. Lina Torres

Indication:
Critical distal tracheal obstruction from bulky squamous cell carcinoma.

Procedure:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of distal tracheal tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia:
General anesthesia, rigid bronchoscope, ASA class IV.

Findings:
Nearly occlusive exophytic tumor in the distal trachea just above the carina, leaving a pinpoint lumen with severe airflow limitation.

Interventions:
Rigid coring performed repeatedly through the tumor. Tumor fragments were removed with forceps and suction. Microdebrider used to further debulk residual tumor and restore lumen diameter. Debulking was entirely mechanical with explicit tumor excision; no ablation used.

Hemostasis:
Moderate bleeding controlled with cold saline, topical epinephrine, and short tamponade with the rigid bronchoscope.

EBL:
70 mL.

Complications:
Desaturation into mid-80s during initial passes, improved with recruitment.

Disposition:
Remained intubated and admitted to ICU for ventilatory support and further oncologic management.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Critical distal tracheal obstruction from squamous cell carcinoma.
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT chest with distal tracheal mass and near-complete obstruction.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of distal tracheal tumor.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Endobronchial squamous cell carcinoma of distal trachea.

lines.selection_reason: Documentation supports mechanical debulking/excision (rigid coring, microdebrider) without thermal ablation.

per_code.summary: Kept. Supported by explicit description of mechanical excision (rigid coring, microdebrider) and absence of thermal ablation.

global_comments: Procedure involved purely mechanical debulking; CPT 31640 is appropriate.

note_text:
BRONCHOSCOPY NOTE – MECHANICAL DEBULKING OF BENIGN TRACHEAL STENOSIS

Patient: Laura Perez, 44-year-old female
MRN: S31640-018
Date: 2024-10-08
Location: Southside Medical Pavilion – Bronchoscopy Suite
Attending: Dr. Henry Wallace

Indication:
Benign post-intubation tracheal stenosis with exertional dyspnea.

Procedure:
Flexible bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of granulation tissue and scar (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia / Sedation:
Moderate sedation with midazolam and fentanyl, topical lidocaine. Native airway. ASA class II.

Findings:
Short-segment circumferential granulation and scar in mid-trachea narrowing lumen by ~65%.

Interventions:
Mechanical debulking done with forceps to remove granulation tissue; snare resection of a fibrotic ridge. No balloon dilation, no ablation. Tracheal lumen improved to mild residual narrowing.

Hemostasis:
Minimal oozing controlled with cold saline.

EBL:
5 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Discharged home after observation; plan for repeat bronchoscopy and possible balloon dilation in future if restenosis occurs.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Benign post-intubation tracheal stenosis causing exertional dyspnea.
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT neck with focal mid-tracheal stenosis consistent with post-intubation scar.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Flexible bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of benign tracheal stenosis.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Benign post-intubation tracheal stenosis with granulation tissue.

lines.selection_reason: Documentation supports mechanical debulking/excision (forceps, snare) without thermal ablation.

per_code.summary: Kept. Supported by explicit description of mechanical excision (forceps, snare) and absence of thermal ablation.

global_comments: Procedure involved purely mechanical debulking; CPT 31640 is appropriate.

note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY – RIGID BRONCHOSCOPY WITH MECHANICAL DEBULKING

Patient: Daniel Scott, 68-year-old male
MRN: S31640-019
Date: 2024-10-23
Hospital: Northern Plains Medical Center – OR
Attending: Dr. Priya Mehta

Indication:
Central obstruction of left mainstem from non–small cell lung cancer with uncontrolled wheeze and dyspnea.

Procedure:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of left mainstem tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia:
General anesthesia; rigid bronchoscope. ASA class III.

Findings:
Friable tumor filling ~85% of the left mainstem lumen with distal atelectasis.

Interventions:
Rigid coring and forceps debulking were used to mechanically debulk and excise the obstructing tumor. No ablation or balloon dilation performed. Lumen improved to moderate residual narrowing with visible lobar orifices.

Hemostasis:
Controlled with cold saline and epinephrine.

EBL:
40 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Extubated and admitted to oncology floor.

registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Centrally obstructing non–small cell carcinoma of the left mainstem bronchus.

note_text:
BRONCHOSCOPY PROCEDURE NOTE – MECHANICAL DEBULKING OF BII MASS

Patient: Isabel Ramos, 57-year-old female
MRN: S31640-020
Date: 2024-11-04
Location: Metro Lung Center – OR
Attending: Dr. Colin Hayes

Indication:
Obstruction of bronchus intermedius (BI) from endobronchial tumor with chronic cough and dyspnea.

Procedure:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of BI tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia:
General anesthesia; rigid bronchoscope; ASA class III.

Findings:
Polypoid mass in the bronchus intermedius with ~80% obstruction.

Interventions:
Rigid coring and forceps debulking were used to mechanically debulk and excise the tumor. Tumor removed in piecemeal fashion until the lumen was ~60% patent. No thermal ablation or balloon used.

Hemostasis:
Mild; controlled with cold saline.

EBL:
15 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Extubated and discharged to floor for overnight observation.
